I hope I don't make anybody mad about trying to have a schedule for 
topics. [If you have a suggested topic, email me!!] One of my goals is 
to have a steady stream of discussion for this group (~30 messages  
per month).  Once we finish up with the character evaluations and go 
through the hybrid/dual class discussion, I do not plan on hitting 
those topics again until January of next year.

When we finish the proposed new promoted character classes, we'll be 
hitting a discussion about health and mana for characters.

After that, the topics are:

1)3 weeks of hybrid/dual class character.  I'll be tackling this in 3 
parts.

2)Game Issues of Potion of Speed, Speed, and Teleporters

3)Game Issues of Generators

4)Game Issues of Experience Points & Experience Levels

5)Game Issues of Basic Intelligence for characters

6)Games Issues of Explosions and character's response to those

7)Scenario Trivia Contest - two to three weeks

8)Review of dph's scenarios - the good, bad, and ugly.  That will take 
a 3 weeks (maybe more).

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

Scenario Trivia Contest Questions
I am only referencing scenarios that have been uploaded by March 31, 
2001 or modified and uploaded afterwards.

The first seven are objective questions:

1)List all the scenarios that are especially difficult for mages and 
archmages.
2)List all the scenarios that are especially difficult for skeletons 
and ghosts.
3)List all the scenarios that are difficult for fire elementals and 
large slime.
4)List all the scenarios that are easier for elves.
5)List all the scenarios that take at least 30 minutes to complete.
6)List all the scenarios in dph's set that use the same map or 
moderately altered version of an existing map.
7)Name the author of the Tyrx Chronicles.

This are the subjective questions:

8)Name the hardest scenario to beat and justify your answer.  I do NOT 
 want an answer about that scenario being the hardest to beat because 
it has the highest experience level opponents, the most opponents, or 
some combination of the previous two.  I am looking for something 
beyond that.
9)Name the scenario that has the best NPCs and justify your answer.
10)Name the scenario that has the most usefull NPCs and justify your 
answer.
11)Name the most annoying scenario to go through and justify your 
answer.
12)Name the most annoying set of scenarios to go through and justify 
your answer.
13)Name the most fun scenario to go through and justify your answer.
14)Name the scenario that takes the longest amount of time to complete 
and explain why it takes so darn long.

Rules
1)Don't email the group with the answers to these questions.
2)Answers should be emailed to ME with the message title of "Scenario 
Trivia Contest".
3)I should receive answers starting from the start of the week we hit 
the discussion about generators through the middle of the week we hit 
discussion about explosions.  If you are concerned about your email 
being delivered on time, twice a week I will be posting whom I 
received answers from.  Also, send it early if you are concerned about 
email being delivered on time.
4)I'll be posting answers to the objective questions.
5)The answers to the subjective questions will be decided by group 
consensus.  I'll bring the question up and the various answers (along 
with the justifications) and we will debate it.
6)75% of the points will be coming from the objective questions.  I 
shouldn't have to mention what percentage of the points will be coming 
 from the subjective questions.

Are there any questions about the questions or suggestions about more 
questions to add?
